subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01F0_01C9E844.C6C0BCF0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

So-

Sounds waves are separate and apart from the electromagnetic spectrum?=


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Ratka 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoog=
roups.com 
  Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:16 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] N=
ew ideas





        Sorry, RJ. I stand corrected! Soundwaves are not EM w=
aves because they lack the EM component and are subject to our physical env=
ironment. Hence, cannot travel at the speed of light. 

        That being =
said, the heterodyne theory still stands. LOL

        Frank R.

        --=
- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...> wrote:


          F=
rom: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =
New ideas
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date: Monday, Jun=
e 8, 2009, 3:05 PM


                Tell me where the seperation on the sp=
ectrum takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure=
 waves that our ears read as vibration and our mind translates as sound. Th=
e waves are still on the electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic geomagneti=
c waves are present on the scale. What I mean by power can be directll tran=
slated to volume or amplitude. The only thing that distinguishes soundwaves=
 from any other wave is the fact that we can hear them.

                Fr=
ank R.

                --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:=



                  From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
                  Subje=
ct: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
=
                  Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:53 PM


                   =
     No. Sounds waves are not on the electromagnet spectrum nor are they a =
form of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on pressure waves in th=
e air (or in other substances).  Our ears detect these pressure waves and t=
ranslate them into sounds we here.  Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet energ=
y.  Our eyes do: that part which we call visible light.



                =
        --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


=
                          From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
     =
                     Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                     =
     To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                          Date: Monday, J=
une 8, 2009, 12:38 PM


                                It sounds like she'=
s saying "one, two, ....."

                                A mistake that =
a lot of people make is thinking that there are two different types of ener=
gy at work when it comes to sound waves and electromagnetic waves. The only=
 thing that seperates them is frequency and power. Radio waves are radio wa=
ves because they occupy a certain block of the electromagnietic spectrum. S=
ound waves exist on that same spectrum just farther down with much longer w=
aves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything because o=
f their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength the more ways we can shield=
 against them.

                                Think of microwaves. These =
are also a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves also=
 have a physical effect on our environment by causing molecules to speed up=
, which creates heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too can=
 cause physical objects to heat up but usually it just causes molecules to =
rotate in place. All physical things give off IR light. Its a way the total=
 system conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.

         =
                       Frank R.

                                --- On Mon=
, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:

=

                                From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombie=
gh ostresearch. com>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]=
 New ideas [3 Attachments]
                                To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups .com
                                Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:=
27 PM


                                Here is some food for thought. I am=
 currently reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.

           =
                     It was me and another girl teammate present in the roo=
m. I picked up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry=
 with me. We were standing right next to another digital video recorder tha=
t I leave beside my night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this=
 3rd voice. I have asked the girl that was with me to check her recording t=
o see if she picked it up.

                                I have long fel=
t the true EVP does not come from sound waves in the environment, or then i=
t wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing dir=
ectly on the recordings.

                                This instance wit=
h the recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder should have pi=
cked that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.

            =
                    I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The file tha=
t is named "01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip. You will hear my voice as I sa=
y "Yeah", and then another comes in right after that. I think I know what i=
t says.

                                Again, I was live monitoring my au=
dio, but still did not hear this until playback. It isn't clear, so I am no=
t as excited about it as my one's from the last investigation.


          =
                      ----- Original Message ----- 
                       =
         From: Frank Ratka 
                                To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups .com 
                                Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 =
1:09 PM
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


=
                                I have a running theory that EVP is carried=
 on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manife=
st. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves =
that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them toget=
her you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghos=
t is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creat=
ing an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate diff=
erence frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). =
This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic=
 signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP w=
ere generated within a few inches of the recorder.

                       =
         We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superh=
eterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sona=
rs and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pomp=
eii.

                                Frank R.

                           =
     --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrote:


       =
                         From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
          =
                      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                    =
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                                Da=
te: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM


                                Fascina=
ting! I've had this idea that the EVP are often not recorded by the microph=
one but somehow make their way in at the actual point where the storage is =
made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital. 

                           =
     So much we don't know ...

                                Zack

     =
                            
                                On Mon, Jun 8,=
 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> =
wrote:




                                I monitor my audio live. The fun=
ny thing is that even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either=
 in the environment, or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them u=
pon playback.

                                ----- Original Message -----=
 
                                From: Zack Widup 
                       =
         To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                                Sent=
: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
                                Subject: R=
e: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                                I am curious if an=
yone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in re=
al time.

                                I took part in an investigation o=
f Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cam=
eras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all was being=
 monitored and recorded at a central location. Alas, we did not have microp=
hones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder what w=
e might have heard if we did?

                                Zack

      =
                           
                                On Mon, Jun 8, =
2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:
=


                                Let's just agree to end this discussion a=
bout her... 
                                Why don't we discuss something=
 on a lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas about either evp or ITC? 
   =
                             Al

                                 

       =
                        

                       

               

       =
